original: Jonsson, Karl Hjalmar, provinsialläkare, Ryd, f. 13/3/97 i Stenstorp, Skarab. k, av August Herman J. o. Gustava Matilda Andersson. G. 27 m. Inez Ingegerd Ahlenius. Barn: Ingegerd Gunilla f. 34. — Stud:ex. i Skövde 16, med. kand. i Upps. 24, med. lic. i Sthlm 28. Tf. prov:läk. i Skövde distr. 28, assist :läk. v. Torsby las. s. å., v. Hudiksvalls las. 29, tf. prov:läk. i Nässjö distr. 29, und :läk. v. Apelvikens kustsan. 30, und :läk. v. Torsby las. 31 -33, tf. andre und:läk. v. Arvika san. samt tf. prov:läk. i Töcksmarks distr. 33, tf. prov :läk. i Vingåkers m. fl. distr. kort. tid. 34-3S, e. läk. v. Säters sjukh. 35-36, därunder tf. förste läk. fyra mån., tf. prov :!läk. i ol. distr. o. tf. liais :läk. i Piteå 36-38, prov .lläk. i Töcksmarks distr. 38, i Ryds distr. sed. 43.
translated: Jonsson, Karl Hjalmar, provincial doctor, Ryd, born on March 13, 1897 in Stenstorp, Skaraborgs County, the son of August Herman J. and Gustava Matilda Andersson. Married in 1927 to Inez Ingegerd Ahlenius, with one child, Ingegerd Gunilla, born in 1934. He graduated from high school in Skövde in 1916, received his medical degree from Uppsala University in 1924, and his medical license in Stockholm in 1928. He worked as a temporary provincial doctor in the Skövde district in 1928, assisting physician at Torsby hospital in the same year, assistant physician at Hudiksvall hospital in 1929, temporary provincial doctor in the Nässjö district in 1929, and assistant physician at Apelvikens coastal sanatorium in 1930. He was also assistant physician at Torsby hospital from 1931 to 1933, temporary second assistant physician at Arvika sanatorium and provisional doctor in Töcksmarks district in 1933, temporary provincial doctor in Vingåkers and other districts for a short period in 1934-1935, and attending physician at Säters hospital from 1935 to 1936, during which time he was temporarily the first physician for four months. He was temporary provincial doctor in Oland's district and temporary deputy physician in Piteå from 1936 to 1938, then served as provincial doctor in the Töcksmark district in 1938 and in the Ryd district from 1943 onwards.
